intro: Melicope versteeghii, commonly known as the Christmas Island melicope, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Christmas Island in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves with a leathery texture. It produces small, white flowers followed by dark purple berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
